column4: I can't live without desktop icons.  Everything that goes to the desktop will not appear on the desktop, but rather... on nautilus.  Any idea why this is happening? :\
Which release of ubuntu and what were you installing or changing before this started
Intrepid64.  I was dd-ing something for DVD media.  Nothing related to Desktop, of course.
as last resort you can reset gnome

To Reset All of Gnome: http://linuxfud.wordpress.com/2007/02/14/how-to-reset-ubuntugnome-settings-to-defaults-without-re-installing/       In terminal type:         rm -rf .gnome .gnome2 .gconf .gconfd .metacity
but you may still need a restart to reset gnome
Sure.  I'll give it a shoot in a bit.
FYI -- I'm back.  I have a weird bug then/
not so uch of a bug as something you did .. Did you install some tool to rip tha dvd?
Sure, some packages.  But that shouldn't conflict with the nautilus... or gnome?  genosismakeiso -- something like that.
right, like I said earlier and you said you were just ripping a dvd.. So you did install things form outside the repos based on some tutorial on the web, so
I was making an ISO from files on my hard drives -- Using the said command -- mkisofs -o /Desktop/xyzdvd.iso ~/Desktop/xyzdvd/
I recently said this -- Maybe you do know?  "Do anybody know how to repair a broken system?  It seems that all of the files in /boot is empty."
too late in my day, winding down.  Without kowing your setups etc I couldnt guess
